text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Crown Prince Mohamed presides over opening of the American-Moroccan trade and investment office in New York.
- The United States pays homage to King Hassan's leadership.
- Finance Minister Mohamed Kabbaj says despite forecasts of a 10 percent increase of the Gross Domestic Product, debt will absorb more than 80 percent of it.
- Crown Prince Mohamed hands message from King Hassan to U.S. President Bill Clinton over the situation in the Middle East.
- Human rights Organisation (OMDH) says consolidation of a state of law is a necessary condition to ensure economic development and political stability.
